intro: Matisia cuatrecasasiana, commonly known as the Cuatrecasas's matisia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Fabaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in countries like Mexico and Colombia. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and produces small, pod-like fruits containing several seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
